author: jwasinger
content:
> How many BALs (for how many blocks) will clients keep (e.g. treated similarly as receipts - using txlookuplimit or enforce a minimum)?

For now, we keep any that we also have the block for.  That may change in the future.

> 2.

Parallel loading from disk is not something we really think about, as the db/OS handles that for us.

Parallel tx execution was pretty straightforward to implement in Geth: we just naively attempt to schedule each tx simultaneously.  And the Go runtime seems to do a decent job, because the performance is vastly improved compared to serial execution.

Right now, the parallel state root calculation is the most complex piece and also the performance bottleneck.  And the slowdown here has to do with the fact that we can no longer warm modified trie nodes from disk in the background while we do serial tx execution.  So with BAL, the state root calculation takes a much larger IO hit.  I'm working on some optimizations here, but they're not complete yet.
